intro: Idothea humilis, commonly known as the dwarf rock cress, is a low-growing perennial plant native to arid and rocky environments in southern Africa. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many flowering plants with small, four-petaled flowers. The plant typically has a mat-forming growth habit, with fleshy, succulent leaves that help it conserve water. Its flowers are usually white or pale yellow, and it produces small, rounded pods that contain seeds. Idothea humilis is well adapted to harsh conditions, making it a resilient and hardy species.
